observation: Home | Branson, Fowlkes & Co. Inc.  19 Briar Hollow Lane, Suite 130, Houston, 713-780-0606 information@bransonfowlkes.com Client Login Menu Home About Us Our Mission Our Company Our Resources Our Team What We Do Wealth Management Strategies Investment Management Strategies Estate Planning Strategies We are Fiduciaries Our Clients Our Research Quarterly Client Report Commentary Educational Videos Financial Calculators Glossary Of Financial Terms In the Community Branson Fowlkes Charitable Foundation It May Be Time for a Financial Checkup It’s never a bad time to speak with your financial professional about changes in your situation. Learn More Coaches Coaches have helped you your whole life, in ways big and small. We'd like to be one of them. A New Way to Look at Your Bucket List Bucket lists don’t have to be for tomorrow. How to Retire Early Retiring early sounds like a dream come true, but it’s important to take a look at the cold, hard facts. We make sure to work closely with you to develop a strategy focused on your goals. Our client-focused approach is the secret to our longevity. We're ready to work with you at every juncture in life. Your success is our success and we'll be with you every step of the way. A team Approach to serving you Our team of experienced financial advisors will work with you to delve deep into your financial history and future goals. From there, we'll create a few custom plans to get you started, and we'll guide you every step of the way. Key Team Members Jay W. Branson CFP®, ChFC Principal Maco Stewart Fowlkes, CFP®, ChFC, CLU, CAP mfowlkes@bransonfowlkes.com Dallas Jones Advisor Michael S. Bishop mbishop@bransonfowlkes.com Mark E. Wilson Associate Trocon G. Reffell, CFP® treffell@bransonfowlkes.com Schedule a Meeting Name Email Address Phone Question Send Thank you! Oops! Download Our Don’t Panic Ebook! The novel coronavirus (COVID-19)’s effects on the financial markets has caused many people to question their investment strategy. Use this ebook to stay focused on your investment goals during challenging times. First Name Last Name Get the Ebook Contact Office: TX 77027 Quick Links Retirement Investment Estate Insurance Tax Money Lifestyle All Articles All Videos All Calculators Check the background of your financial professional on FINRA's BrokerCheck The content is developed from sources believed to be providing accurate information.

thought: The WHOIS information shows that the domain has been registered since 1998 and has a registration expiration date in 2028, which is a good sign as scam websites often have recent registration dates and short registration periods. The domain is registered through GoDaddy and uses a privacy service to keep registrant details private, which is not uncommon for legitimate businesses. The domain has a status that prevents unauthorized transfers, updates, renewals, and deletions, indicating a desire to maintain control over the domain. Next, I'll verify if there are any negative reports or feedback related to the website by searching on social platforms and review websites. Additionally, I will check if the financial professionals listed on the site have any professional records or if they are recognized in their field.

thought: The search results provide information about the firm and its advisors, including their certifications and career history. There are also details about the firm's assets under management and the number of accounts they manage. This information suggests that Branson Fowlkes & Co. Inc. is an established financial advisory firm with experienced professionals. Given that the reviews and information from third-party sources align with the information presented on their website and there are no immediate red flags from these sources, it's reasonable to conclude that this firm may be legitimate. However, for a comprehensive analysis, I will also check for any negative social mentions or complaints.

There are no results from the Twitter search for "Branson Fowlkes scam," which suggests that there may not be any significant negative social mentions or reports of scams associated with Branson Fowlkes & Co. With no indications from the website content, WHOIS information, and external search results to suggest that the URL is a scam website, and considering the professional presentation of the website, the lack of negative social mentions, and the establishment of the firm in third-party sources, I now know the final answer. The URL https://www.bransonfowlkes.com/ does not appear to be a scam website.

observation.reason: The website represents an established financial advisory firm with information corroborated by third-party sources professional presentation lack of negative social mentions and transparency in services offered.
